website_summaries.verdict: This is one of the easiest dog training whistles to use, as it doesn't require much airflow.
pros: Uses a low-pitched sound that will carry over longer distances better than some other training whistles
Design of the whistle directs the sound toward the animal and away from the handler
Doesn't take a lot of practice to start using this whistle successfully with your dog
cons: Doesn't allow for fluctuations in pitch or volume

customer_reviews.title: I love it. The dog isn't so sure.
customer_reviews.text: I have a sitehound, and so it is incredibly difficult to get their attention once they lock onto something of interest. Yelling their name is pointless, clickers are a joke ... and especially if your greyhound/whippet/longdog etc gets away from you unexpectedly, they are at full speed in 3 bounds or so, putting them blocks away and in serious trouble in seconds. I can't say this whistle -- WITH TRAINING -- will break through, but it is a damn sight better than hollering. My dog at least looks up and seems to be associating the sound with me (and treats), so it appears to be working great.
customer_reviews.author: BrySmi

customer_reviews.title: Just don’t not loud at all and takes a lot of effort to blow
customer_reviews.text: Worst whistle I’ve ever used. Hard to blow and make anything more than a slight wheezing whistle out of it. Needs lots of effort to blow this whistle. Even when blowing on it to full capacity it is still not loud at all. Literally had to use my high roller duck call whistle when working the dog because he couldn’t even hear this crappy whistle. Do not buy you will be dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Captain Janot

customer_reviews.title: Two Rowdy Dogs now standing at attention
customer_reviews.text: My dogs respond very well to this. One boxer and one Amstaff terrier. The whistle is audibly LOUD. I wouldn't classify it as a dog whistle, its a loud whistle. It works and that is all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: the guru

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: We had a need for a simple whistle to train our dog respond to, as one of the humans can’t whistle. It seemed easy enough to just buy a simple whistle, one similar to a referee’s whistle, $5 was a shade much, but worth just getting it without going into a store. It was defective, no sharp whistle tones, merely a blow of air and silent fluttering of little ball. I’ve never had that problem in multiple decades of using whistles.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Nice Whistle
customer_reviews.text: Trying to teach my dog to come home by using this whistle. We live on 40 acres and with my cattle dog running over it all, I needed someway to get his attention. No way I can yell that loudly. Whistle has a good tone that seems to travel far. I prefer the no pea type of whistle it doesn't stick like the other type.
customer_reviews.author: MagSam

customer_reviews.title: Love this bright orange whistle with out the pea ... just wish it came with a lanyard!
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound of this whistle! I have always wanted to whistle like my dad whistled when he wanted us to come home for dinner. Believe me, I tried ... for years! This is the perfect whistle (without the pea) ... and now I can whistle with a little help from my new whistle. My dog responds great to the whistle ... and will turn on a dime when he hears it! Added bonus: Due to the bright orange color ... I can easily find it in my purse or fanny pack/waist bag. One suggestion: please add a lanyard.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Terry J. Moody

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far no issues! I’m loving this for training my dogs! Now I don’t have to hurt my voice hollering for them outside. I just use this whistle and they come running!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these three years ago. The only regret I had was that I didn't buy more. Ordered 5 more to keep in the truck, on a call lanyard, in the blind, etc.
customer_reviews.author: NML045

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 or 6 of these and have never had a problem. If you get one with teh pea, stick with it, same if you get the pealess, they make different sounds.
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: Good little whistle!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I wanted it for which was teaching my pup recall. I blow it, she comes running! No lanyard which would have been nice, but fits nicely in my pocket, so that’s all good. Rubber band shown did come on mine. Not sure what that does, but it’s still on there.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Consumer

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 4 year old son because daddy and grandpa each have one. He loves it. He asked if it was his birthday when we gave it to him. It's sturdy, a good size, and LOUD! I wish it came with a tether, but the listing clearly shows it doesn't come with one. 5 start, would order again (or should I say *WILL* order again when he loses this one!) :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: best ever. Always has been
customer_reviews.text: best ever. Always has been, always will be. Thirty years, using the same product. I use them enough I chew the ends, like a fine cigar. And, because I simply can't understand some things that dogs do. They have more then one model, so read about the difference, and decide which is best for you. Every one, is top notch. Best wishes friends. Mike in Oregon. Bird hunter, retriever trainer,
customer_reviews.author: Andhonor

customer_reviews.title: Not the best out there
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for dog training. Smaller than a regular whistle. You have to blow it exactly right to get a good clear sound. I would not purchase this one again when I need a new whistle.
customer_reviews.author: TXnNC

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Same whistle you can buy at dollar store but the one at the dollar store has a lanyard. Don’t know why it is advertised as for dogs it’s a regular old whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Great little whistle
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these, they’re loud enough to get dog’s attention since I can’t whistle loudly on my own. Pretty basic but effective and just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Emptysack

customer_reviews.title: Dog Training Whistle that barely gets my dogs attention
customer_reviews.text: doesn't seem to be effective at getting the attention of my dogs. I figured it wouldn't make much noise that humans could hear since it is 'lower-pitched sound' but it does make very audible noise.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Duzan

customer_reviews.title: Loud and clear. Get's our dogs attention quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs have a lot of room to run and I can't whistle that loud or yell to where they can hear. But I use the whistle and they come running! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: B. Shull

customer_reviews.title: Not very loud
customer_reviews.text: Not real loud like I wanted. You have to blow into it just right to get the sound. Bought it for my son to go hunting as a distress call if needed. But no where near loud enough
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: using for recall training
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to train the Australian shepherd puppy (8 months old) to come. She can hear it at a couple of hundred yards. The trick (apparently) to training to come to a whistle is to use very high value treats. Now in the second week of training and when she hears the whistle she comes. Will continue training for a couple of more weeks. Will be getting a second one to keep in the car. update: after about five-six weeks of twice a day training she comes running when she hears the whistle.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Great Whistle
customer_reviews.text: If I only had one one whistle, this would be it. It has a nice crisp tone to which the dogs respond well, is compact in size and is quite light to carry around my neck on a lanyard. I bought this one to replace a Roy Gonia whistle made of another type of plastic which was orange in color. I loved that whistle also, but I broke it with time and modest pressure in my mouth. This one seems to be a lot more durable. I spend a lot of time in the field with my dogs and this whistle goes with me every time.
customer_reviews.author: Blueridge

customer_reviews.title: Love the color can't ever get lost!
customer_reviews.text: There were no whistles anywhere! We had have one so I was so pleased to have found this one and it worked just as it should have! Thank you for making these whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Jo Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: good for dogs
customer_reviews.text: this dog whistle is good for training dogs. My dog does pay attention to it. It blows fine. I like the orange color which stands out.
customer_reviews.author: duckman

customer_reviews.title: He could hear it easy at 25 or 250 yards
customer_reviews.text: I used this thru the last season to run my bird dog. He is whistle trained to return. This was his first year after training. Its plenty loud and consistent. He could hear it easy at 25 or 250 yards.
customer_reviews.author: PRC

customer_reviews.title: If you want a garbled sounding whistle, this is it.
customer_reviews.text: The whistle has a garbled sound. Not a clear whistle. I believe the issue is the pea size is too big. Mine did not come with the rubber band around the snout like the picture shows.
customer_reviews.author: JamesW

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Meh . Not very loud . Or easy to use. I need these for labrador Training this one will not cut it
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Whistle
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. It’s loud, it’s quality and sturdy. Works in rain, snow or shine! Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Dog Whistles that humans can hear?
customer_reviews.text: I assumed dog whistles are such that only dogs can hear them and humans cant. Just got my whistle and not only can I hear it, it is deafening. Maybe I missed something in the product and if so will adjust my review accordingly. I did order it yesterday and received it yesterday and I guess everything is made in China even a $4 dog whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne A Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Preliminary = not sure.
customer_reviews.text: Not as loud as I had hoped. Takes a lot of wind. Looks like Nice well made product
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiked
customer_reviews.text: Great for hikes. My dog goes off trail and always come back when i whistle
customer_reviews.author: avid mystery reader

customer_reviews.title: Good for walks
customer_reviews.text: This really gets my older dog’s attention when calling her isn’t effective.
customer_reviews.author: Kubush

customer_reviews.title: My dogs don't aways come when I use it
customer_reviews.text: My dogs don't aways come when I use it, But they come most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Beard

customer_reviews.title: Not that bad of a dog whistle
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this is the worst whistle I have ever used. Does it take some time to figure out how to get the pitch correct, I would say so. I had no problem with the whistle and given the cheap cost, I found this item to be a steal for dog training purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice noisy whistle
customer_reviews.text: Certainly gets our dog’s attention and everyone in the neighbourhood.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Watson

customer_reviews.title: The best dog whistle
customer_reviews.text: I have used Roy Gonia dog whistles for years, and have one that is 20 years old that still works fine. I have trained four Labradors with them.
customer_reviews.author: H C

customer_reviews.title: Whistle works good for recall of my dog he listens to it very well.
customer_reviews.text: I use the whistle for recall for my Golden Retriever in training .It's loud enough and gets his attention
customer_reviews.author: Riley1

customer_reviews.title: get the one with ratle
customer_reviews.text: I got the one without a rattle and a not sure how well it works for doggies
customer_reviews.author: Estes C. Thompson II

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I got the one with the rubber band on it. You can hold it in your mouth longer
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog to get his attention at the dog park
customer_reviews.author: Terri Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Can hear it a long ways
customer_reviews.text: This is a very loud whistle--easy for the dog to hear.
customer_reviews.author: MOON

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: I really don't understand what people are saying this is fantastic it's well made its easy to blow and it works....
customer_reviews.author: BigJake

customer_reviews.title: dog trainer
customer_reviews.text: wasn't as loud as expected and resemble more of a toy,purchased another brand to replace
customer_reviews.author: barry wachter

customer_reviews.title: It works fine
customer_reviews.text: This wasn’t as loud as I would have liked. It will do the job though
customer_reviews.author: 51slowsmarts

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy nice whistle
customer_reviews.text: I purchase them for training my dog the sound is good
customer_reviews.author: stephanie wynne

customer_reviews.title: Ball gets stuck
customer_reviews.text: This whistle sucks! Ball gets stuck and makes this god-aweful straight high pitch sound. Have to hold it a certain way to get a whistle sound that the dog's will come to. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: tlturner

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: So far works well. Very loud. Haven’t been out all day in the cold so don’t if it will freeze. Oh, I ordered three and received two.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T Jones

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Loud and clear I like the rubber band around it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I've only had one of these so maybe it was just a bad one but this whistle barely worked. The ball on the inside didn't vibrate causing the whistle to just be very high pitch, which did the exact opposite for training my duck dog. Not a fan, threw it away and will get a another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Milstead

customer_reviews.title: Cork ball sucks
customer_reviews.text: The cork ball gets stuck and whistle doesn't sound right.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco45

customer_reviews.title: Excellent whistle.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent whistle and carries sound well. It never fails to get dog back.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey D.

customer_reviews.title: Alright Whistle
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars since it is not as loud as I had hoped. It works for calling my dogs back to the house nearby, but its not good for distance.
customer_reviews.author: Syks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Overpriced!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price. I later found one at my local hardware store that was more robust, came with a lanyard, and cost half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ken D Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I work my German Short Haired Pointer in field trials. We are able to stay in communication with this whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Donald W King

customer_reviews.title: Great whistle for dog training
customer_reviews.text: Great WhistleGreat whistle for dog training. would buy a gun
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent whistle
customer_reviews.text: I bought the whistle to call back my dog on walks when she is too far away for me to call or whistle for. She responded immediately and comes back at full speed. Love the whistle, will order more. Is essential. Good high pitch sound, great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ullie

customer_reviews.title: Whistle doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: it doesn’t work. You hear the ball rattling around but blow all you want, no sound. I may have gotten a defective one but looking at the reviews, I should have known
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This whistle blows
customer_reviews.text: This whistle has to be blown just right. Not to hard, not to soft. Sound doesn’t come out 90% of the time. That’s terrible for Dog training or hunting. I’ll be buying a better whistle.
customer_reviews.author: WesleyVaughn

customer_reviews.title: Great whistle
customer_reviews.text: One of the best whistle out there use it train all my pointers
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Working dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a tool for me. My dogs clearly hear it and respond to it. It works very well so far.
customer_reviews.author: kg

customer_reviews.title: Great dog whistle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dog whistle. Finally got my little door dashing dog’s attention! Very loud whistle.... good for scaring off coyotes!
customer_reviews.author: CAROL H.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great for the most part.
customer_reviews.text: It is a whistle. Not sure if it is good for training dogs. Hurts my ears and my Yorkie still ignores me.
customer_reviews.author: CMG

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good one to buy for money
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good whistle. Starting training my dogs with it. Have to blow pretty hard to get it to work properly but other than that seems good
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Warren

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced cheap plastic whistle.
customer_reviews.text: It's grossly overpriced for a basically cheap whistle that can be bought in any 99 cent store for even less.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: It will do
customer_reviews.text: I haven't got a chance to use it since the season is closed but I'm sure it'll do alright.
customer_reviews.author: Taftmanian

customer_reviews.title: Great Whistle
customer_reviews.text: These are great dog whistles. My dog can hear them from a quite a distance and she comes to them extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good whistle
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for recalling my dog on hiking trails. Not so loud that I worry about disturbing people too much, but loud enough to get my dogs attention.
customer_reviews.author: Wkhorn

customer_reviews.title: works fine, not dog
customer_reviews.text: Got my old dog's attention better than cheap whistle I had, not that he will respond unless he wants to! Someone mentioned need for lanyard. I bought one on Amazon-yellow dog design (appropriate!) very comfortable, attractive, but a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Herb

customer_reviews.title: Gave as gifts to new puppy owners.
customer_reviews.text: Roy Gonia classic. Gave as gifts to new puppy owners
customer_reviews.author: Richard C Wendell

customer_reviews.title: Working well for us !!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good have been using this for our pup almost a year old. She has responded well to call backs and even directional retrieval. Really coming along in her training
customer_reviews.author: King Nutta

customer_reviews.title: So simple...yet wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered with No Pea. Packing says No Pea. Whistle has a pea. Come on Sport Dog...lame.
customer_reviews.author: Pully Wissle

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Kind of cheap plastic but at least the ring is solid.
customer_reviews.author: PDX_Boats

customer_reviews.title: Small, loud, cool, & orange.
customer_reviews.text: Nice whistle, easy to control low or high volume tones by blowing a bit harder/etc. I had a cheapie whistle before this one and can easily tell the difference. Worth the extra couple bucks or so.
customer_reviews.author: gmansocal

customer_reviews.title: Loud and clear
customer_reviews.text: Really nice whistle, loud crisp sound. Dog reacts to it well!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Worst whistle I've ever blown.
customer_reviews.text: Worst whistle I've ever blown! Didn't realize it didn't have a pea when I bought it. Really bad.
customer_reviews.author: Millers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good whistle. Sharp and crisp sound and certainly loud enough.
customer_reviews.author: JerryNich

customer_reviews.title: Good whistle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this whistle to call in my 11-year-old GSD from the yard. My yard is a fenced in half acre, and my dog is very hard of hearing. This whistle does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Nice whistle!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for our hearing impared dog. While he doesn't jump at the sound of it, he does acknowledge the noise. Would recommend for dog training, correcting negative behaviors, etc.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Nice loud whistle
customer_reviews.text: I'm still working on getting my dog trained, but this whistle puts out a nice loud tweet that she responds to very quickly. I do wish it came with a lanyard, but any sort of cord would fit just fine on the miniature key ring included on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Just a whistle. Could've bought the same from the sports dept at Walmart. On the plus side it's very well built and durable
customer_reviews.author: arthur melo

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: This is not a high quality product but it works great! I bought several for the group of guys we hunt with as they were low cost wich was great
customer_reviews.author: Coyoteslayer

customer_reviews.title: LOUD whistle
customer_reviews.text: only complaint is you have to blow hard to get it to whistle. There isn't a soft, light whistle. it's either ear piercing or nothing. Great for outdoors in the field
customer_reviews.author: A_O

customer_reviews.title: dog did not respond
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought whistle to train my new dog, but she did not respond well. I am a new dog owner so maybe I did not train well, but I found a new use for whistle. When I teach class, if the students become too loud, I blow my whistle instead of shouting.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a whistle and serves it's purpose! Cant complain about anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila M.

customer_reviews.title: Order more than one.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a crap shoot. Some work great some are terrible. Too cheap to hassle with. Order at least two and maybe get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Keith T Sivertson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a whistle but u pay for what u get.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleb Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Loud small whistle; works great.
customer_reviews.text: Good little and very loud whistle, and yes, your dogs can't miss it!
customer_reviews.author: SewNew61

customer_reviews.title: GO Roy Gonia!
customer_reviews.text: I had Roy Gonia whistles last time I had Brittanys. It was a must have as soon as I got this puppy too! Best whistles out there.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Macomb

customer_reviews.title: Great whistle.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs took to the sound almost immediately. I can now let them roam a lot farther afield and be able to recall at almost any distance. Great whistle..
customer_reviews.author: JMICIK

customer_reviews.title: small and good sound but prefer those with the pea inside for ...
customer_reviews.text: light, small and good sound but prefer those with the pea inside for a rattling sound.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I can call my six little dogs in ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ! I can call my six little dogs in even on those mornings when I'm too dry to whistle !
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I just wish it had a lanyard or something with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Whistle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little whistle to call your dog. My grandson also loves it, so I've ordered one for him also, probably to his parents great chagrin!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Terrill

customer_reviews.title: Nice product , prompt service
customer_reviews.text: Good price works well as I can not whistle & dogs listen with this
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Pinto

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: My friend is always screaming at her dogs. Ordered the whistle to avoid that. My dog will come when I use the whistle even though she is not in sight. Would have preferred metal. I put a cord on it and wear it around my neck.
customer_reviews.author: sandy b

customer_reviews.title: good whistle
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this whistle is loud, My dog can hear it from far away. We are still learning to train her to come with a whistle, does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Sport Dog Brand Orange whistle
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps this whistle is for a country dog.... I have trouble teaching my two year old dog to give me his attention when there are distractions- the whistle has no effect on him. Perhaps in the field this would be an excellent whistle. There's nothing wrong with the whistle, I think I'm using it in the wrong place- city sidewalks. Actually my main purpose was to distract him from getting into trouble- dosen't work for that, but again I think I'm using it in the wrong place.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Hank

customer_reviews.title: Just got this. Thought at first maybe I got ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this. Thought at first maybe I got a defective one. Hardly any sound at all. Expected it to be much louder, but my dog hears it so it must be working!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Letts

customer_reviews.title: plastic whistle
customer_reviews.text: it works fine ... not the loudest or strongerst but it is exactly what you would expect to get for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: scooby doo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works, but seems to need more air to make it loud.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Dog's best
customer_reviews.text: best one out there! tried a lot of others but this one beats them all-sure cuts down on using an E=Coller!
customer_reviews.author: Ron senior

customer_reviews.title: A Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I recently rescued a dog that had a real problem chasing trucks - It took 2 days to condition her to the whistle and now I have her full attention at any time. It may truly be a life saver. The bad reviews were written by people that do not know how to train dogs. It does exactly what it is intended to do. I plan to by a few more so I always have one handy!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

product_meta.title: SportDOG Brand Roy Gonia Whistle- Hunting Dog Training Whistle with Easy-to-Blow Design- For Training or Field Use
product_meta.description: Style:Clear with PeaThe Roy Gonia Special is hand-crafted and used to train more Field Champions than any other whistle. The whistle features a lower-pitched sound that carries farther and an easy-to-blow design for effective communication while training or in the field.
feature_bullets: Used to train more field champions than any other whistle

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
